channel.title: stdout security
channel.description:
Bite-sized, daily Cyber Security wrap-ups to get you prepped for your day.
Note: This is an AI-generated summary of News Articles from the past 24 hours. I take no credit for the research or analysis in said articles - this podcast only exists as a simple audio summary to help busy, sleep-deprivd Cyber Nerds like myself keep on top of developments while wranging kids and brushing teeth.
channel.author: Opalsec
channel.itunes:author: Opalsec
channel.itunes:summary: Bite-sized, daily Cyber Security wrap-ups to get you prepped for your day.

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, January 2, 2026
item.description:
stdout: Your Daily Cyber Security Briefing üá¶üá∫

Dive into the last 24 hours of critical cyber developments! üöÄ We're tracking a $3.9M crypto heist from Unleash Protocol via smart contract compromise and the arrest of a Lithuanian national for a $1.2M clipboard-stealing malware operation. Get the lowdown on a coordinated campaign exploiting 10+ Adobe ColdFusion CVEs, plus Amazon thwarting over 1,800 suspected North Korean operatives infiltrating its workforce. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Unpack new threats including the RondoDox botnet actively exploiting the critical React2Shell vulnerability (CVE-2025-55182, CVSS 10.0) on 90,000+ susceptible devices. Discover the resurfaced GlassWorm supply chain attack targeting macOS users with malicious Open VSX extensions, and Kaspersky's discovery of Keenadu pre-installed Android malware. We also cover OceanLotus (APT32) targeting China's Xinchuang initiative with a unique ELF Trojan. üíª

Explore the emerging IPCola proxy botnet with 1.6M+ IPs and the ErrTraffic cybercrime toolkit automating "ClickFix" attacks. Understand how a global Magecart campaign is evolving into full identity compromise, and the intricacies of GhostAd (Android) and SkyWalk (iOS) mobile ad fraud schemes. We also reveal a 4-second window in AWS IAM eventual consistency allowing persistence after key deletion. üîí

Finally, we examine "hacktivist proxy operations" providing plausible deniability for states, Meta's alleged "playbook" to mislead regulators on scam ads, Disney's $10M COPPA settlement, and Reddit banning the r/ChatGPTjailbreak community for deepfake content. Stay informed, stay secure. üí°

item.title: Daily News Update: Thursday, January 1, 2026
item.description:
üö® stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üö®

Dive into the latest 24-hour cyber landscape! This episode unpacks significant active events, emerging threats, and critical vulnerabilities. We cover the Unleash Protocol's $3.9M crypto loss due to an unauthorised contract upgrade via a multisig governance exploit, and the European Space Agency's 200GB data breach from external servers.

Explore new attack vectors with the Chinese APT DarkSpectre's browser extension campaigns impacting over 8.8 million users, and the novel ErrTraffic cybercrime service automating ClickFix attacks. On the exploitation front, the RondoDox botnet is actively leveraging the critical React2Shell flaw (CVE-2025-55182) in Next.js servers to deploy cryptominers and Mirai variants. Plus, a severe authentication bypass (CVE-2025-13915) in IBM API Connect demands immediate patching.

Also, hear about ALPHV BlackCat affiliates pleading guilty to extortion, Disney's $10M COPPA penalty, Hong Kong's new "Money Safe" anti-fraud measures, and the mysterious delisting of Intellexa/Predator spyware individuals by OFAC. Finnish authorities have also seized a ship suspected of damaging a Baltic Sea subsea cable. Stay informed, stay secure!

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, December 31, 2025
item.description:
üö® **Active Threats & Breaches:** Two ex-incident responders pleaded guilty to launching BlackCat ransomware attacks against US organisations. An ex-Coinbase agent was arrested for selling 70,000 customer records, leading to phishing and attempted extortion. South Korea's KT Telecom faced scrutiny over insecure femtocells enabling fraud and communication snooping. Plus, the European Space Agency confirmed a breach of external servers, with 200GB of data exfiltrated.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è **New Techniques & Threat Actors:** Chinese state-backed Mustang Panda is deploying a novel kernel-mode rootkit for the ToneShell backdoor, targeting governments in Southeast and East Asia. Cybercrime group Silver Fox is hitting Indian users with tax-themed phishing delivering ValleyRAT via DLL hijacking, and utilising SEO poisoning for backdoor distribution. A new "Zoom Stealer" campaign, linked to DarkSpectre, is harvesting corporate meeting intelligence from 2.2 million users via malicious browser extensions.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Critical Vulnerabilities & AI Security:** A high-severity information disclosure flaw in MongoDB Server, dubbed "MongoBleed" (CVE-2025-14847), is under active exploitation, allowing unauthenticated attackers to leak sensitive server memory. OpenAI warns that prompt injection for AI browser agents may never be fully "solved," highlighting evolving security risks. We also touch on the call for a unified federal framework for AI regulation in the US amidst fragmented state laws.

item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, December 30, 2025
item.description:
üö® stdout Daily Briefing: Your daily dive into the last 24 hours of cyber security. Tracking significant breaches: insider threats at Coupang (33M customer data) & Coinbase (69.5k customers), plus external leaks impacting Wired subscribers (2.3M emails) & Korean Air employees.

üí∞ Ransomware rampages on: Gentlemen ransomware hits Oltenia Energy Complex, and a supply chain attack on Marquis Software affects up to 1.35 million bank customers via a SonicWall exploit. A critical compromise of Trust Wallet's browser extension also led to a $7 million crypto heist from 2,596 wallets.

‚ö†Ô∏è Stay ahead of active threats: CVE-2025-14847 (MongoBleed), a critical MongoDB vulnerability allowing unauthenticated data leaks, and the ongoing exploitation of a five-year-old Fortinet FortiOS 2FA bypass (CVE-2020-12812) in SSL VPNs.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è New tradecraft: a sophisticated spear-phishing campaign using 27 malicious npm packages for resilient hosting, targeting critical infrastructure-adjacent organisations. Plus, a major arrest in a clipper malware operation that stole $1.2 million in crypto by swapping clipboard addresses on 2.8 million systems.

üí° We also analyse the inadequacy of traditional security frameworks against AI-specific attack vectors, with 23.77 million secrets leaked via AI systems in 2024 alone. Finally, explore Europe's push for digital sovereignty with GAIA-X and France's CNIL fining Nexpublica France ‚Ç¨1.7 million for poor cyber security practices and GDPR violations.

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, December 28, 2025
item.description: Dive into the latest cyber security developments with stdout. Today, we unpack a high-severity vulnerability impacting MongoDB: CVE-2025-14847. Rated CVSS 8.7, this flaw allows unauthenticated clients to read uninitialised heap memory, potentially exposing sensitive in-memory data. üö® We analyse the technical specifics: the issue stems from improper handling of length parameter inconsistency within Zlib compressed protocol headers. Mismatched length fields can lead to the disclosure of internal state information or pointers, which could significantly aid further exploitation. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Are your MongoDB deployments at risk? We detail the affected versions, including 8.2.0-8.2.3, 8.0.0-8.0.16, 7.0.0-7.0.26, 6.0.0-6.0.26, 5.0.0-5.0.31, 4.4.0-4.4.29, and all 4.2, 4.0, and 3.6 series. ‚ö†Ô∏è Crucially, patches are available in versions 8.2.3, 8.0.17, 7.0.28, 6.0.27, 5.0.32, and 4.4.30. If immediate patching isn't feasible, we discuss the recommended mitigation: disabling zlib compression on your MongoDB Server. üõ†Ô∏è

item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, December 27, 2025
item.description:
üö® **Breach Alert!** The Trust Wallet Chrome extension (v2.68.0) was compromised, leading to an estimated $7 million in crypto losses through seed phrase exfiltration. Plus, pro-Russian group NoName057(16) claims a DDoS attack on France's La Poste, and GrubHub users received fraudulent crypto scam emails from a legitimate subdomain.
üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è **APT Insights:** Kaspersky uncovers the China-linked Evasive Panda (Bronze Highland) APT, which deployed its MgBot backdoor via DNS poisoning and adversary-in-the-middle attacks. Discover their sophisticated techniques, including custom encryption and payloads disguised as PNGs, targeting entities in T√ºrkiye, China, and India.
ü§ñ **AI in Cyber Warfare:** The accelerating pace of AI-driven attacks demands a strategic shift. We explore how threat actors exploit vulnerabilities within minutes and the critical need for defenders to leverage AI in defence. Plus, re-evaluate your tabletop exercises to simulate AI-powered attacks, including prompt injection and data exfiltration, and discover the importance of 'analog friction' for critical actions.

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, December 17, 2025
item.description:
üö® Breaches & Attacks: ShinyHunters targets PornHub (via Mixpanel SMS phishing) and SoundCloud, exposing millions of user records. RansomHouse hits Askul, stealing 740,000 customer details via compromised credentials lacking multi-factor authentication. Venezuela's PDVSA also reports a cyberattack impacting administrative systems.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è New Threats & Techniques: Discover SantaStealer, a new malware-as-a-service aiming for in-memory operation, despite poor OpSec. Amazon Threat Intelligence reveals Russia's GRU (Sandworm) shifting to exploit misconfigured AWS edge devices for critical infrastructure access. Huntress Labs warns of a surge in hypervisor ransomware, with Akira leading the charge. Plus, a malicious NuGet package, "Tracer.Fody.NLog," found stealing crypto wallet data for nearly six years.

üí• Active Exploitation: Threat actors are actively weaponising the critical React2Shell vulnerability (CVE-2025-55182, CVSS 10.0) to deploy Linux backdoors and steal cloud/AI credentials, with over 111,000 IPs vulnerable. Also, unauthenticated bypass flaws in Fortinet FortiGate devices (CVE-2025-59718, CVE-2025-59719) are under active exploitation, allowing attackers to export device configurations if FortiCloud SSO is enabled. Patch immediately or disable FortiCloud SSO!

‚öñÔ∏è Privacy & Policy: The Texas AG sues major smart TV manufacturers (Sony, Samsung, LG, Hisense, TCL) over alleged secret recording and selling of viewing habits via ACR. We also cover challenges for CISA renewal, MI6's tech-augmented intelligence vision, Google discontinuing its "dark web report" tool, and European law enforcement dismantling a ‚Ç¨10M call centre fraud network.

item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, December 16, 2025
item.description:
stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üéôÔ∏è

Catch up on the last 24 hours in cyber security! üö® We analyse active cyber events, new techniques, and critical vulnerabilities you need to know.

Breaches & Active Attacks: The French Interior Ministry confirms an email server attack, while Jaguar Land Rover reveals payroll data theft by Scattered Lapsus Hunters. Financial sector breaches hit Prosper Marketplace (13.1M) and 700Credit (5.8M), exposing sensitive PII. An insider breach at Opexus compromised federal agency data, and Spanish police nab a suspect for selling 64M records. Plus, track espionage from WIRTE/Ashen Lepus and APT36, alongside Operation Hanoi Thief targeting Vietnamese entities.

Techniques & Tradecraft: Dive into evolving threat actor tradecraft. üõ†Ô∏è Active Adversary-in-the-Middle (AitM) phishing campaigns are bypassing MFA for Microsoft 365 and Okta SSO users, while large-scale phishing leverages fake Calendly invites and Browser-in-the-Browser techniques. Discover how digital calendar subscriptions are exploited for malicious content, and learn about the advanced tactics of 'The Gentlemen' ransomware. Interestingly, CyberVolk's VolkLocker RaaS has a critical flaw allowing free decryption!

Exploited Vulnerabilities: Urgent patches are out for actively exploited zero-days! üêû Apple and Google addressed critical WebKit bugs (CVE-2025-14174, CVE-2025-43529) used by commercial spyware. We also cover a SOAPwn vulnerability in .NET, an un-CVE'd flaw in Gladinet CentreStack/Triofox, and the actively exploited WinRAR path traversal (CVE-2025-6218). Widespread exploitation continues for React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182), linked to multiple state-backed groups. Plus, a new Windows RasMan DoS zero-day has unofficial patches available.

Key Developments: üåê CISA & MITRE release the 2025 CWE Top 25, with XSS still at number one. The NCSC weighs in on cyber-deception, and Microsoft rolls out new PowerShell security warnings and a Baseline Security Mode for Office. We also touch on upcoming US travel data requirements, a Ukrainian national charged for critical infrastructure attacks, and Denmark's controversial VPN proposals. Stay informed on these crucial developments!

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, December 8, 2025
item.description:
üá¶üá∫ stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üá¶üá∫

Today, we unpack a critical development for cybersecurity analysts: Portugal's new legal safe harbour for good-faith security research. üõ°Ô∏è This pivotal policy update, Article 8.o-A, now exempts ethical vulnerability detection from previous cybercrime classifications, empowering researchers to uncover exploitable weaknesses without legal fear. üîç

We detail the strict conditions governing this exemption, including immediate disclosure, no economic benefit beyond professional compensation, and prohibitions against service disruption or data harm. This move aims to foster proactive identification of vulnerabilities and improve overall cyber resilience. üöÄ

Understand how Portugal's stance aligns with an international trend, mirroring protections in Germany and the US, and its implications for responsible vulnerability disclosure and the future of ethical hacking. Essential insights for every analyst tracking the evolving threat landscape. üåê

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, December 7, 2025
item.description:
üö® stdout: Daily Cyber Briefing üö®

Dive into the latest cyber threats! This episode unpacks CVE-2025-55182, "React2Shell," a critical 10.0 CVSS insecure deserialisation flaw in React Server Components. üí• Actively exploited by China state-nexus groups like Earth Lamia, Jackpot Panda, and UNC5174, this vulnerability enables unauthenticated RCE, leading to AWS credential theft attempts, cryptojacking, and downloader deployment across an estimated 2.15 million internet-facing instances. CISA has added it to their KEV catalogue, confirming widespread impact and urgent mitigation needs.

We also analyse groundbreaking threat research: discover "IDEsaster" and "PromptPwnd," over 30 new vulnerabilities in AI coding tools like GitHub Copilot and Google Gemini. ü§ñ These flaws leverage prompt injection and auto-approved agent calls for data exfiltration and RCE. Plus, learn about a novel SVG/CSS clickjacking technique by Lyra Rebane, bypassing the same-origin policy to exfiltrate sensitive data, even when JavaScript is blocked. üñºÔ∏è

Stay informed on evolving attack vectors: the FBI warns of a rise in AI-enhanced virtual kidnapping scams, using doctored social media images for fake proof-of-life in extortion attempts. üìû Finally, we examine the shift to phishing-resistant passkeys, exploring their cryptographic benefits, widespread adoption, and the remaining social engineering risks for multi-device implementations. üîë

item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, December 6, 2025
item.description:
stdout: Your Daily Cyber Briefing üá¶üá∫

Stay ahead with stdout, your daily deep dive into critical cyber security developments. We analyse active cyber events, emerging attack techniques, and exploited vulnerabilities impacting analysts today.

üö® Active Breaches & Ransomware:

  • Pharmaceutical firm Inotiv impacted by a Qilin ransomware attack, affecting 9,542 individuals with 176GB of data exfiltrated.
  • Asus confirms a third-party supplier compromise by the Everest ransomware gang, resulting in 1TB of camera source code theft.
  • Barts Health NHS Trust reports a data breach following a Clop ransomware Oracle zero-day exploit, exposing patient invoice details and former employee data.

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è New Threats & Techniques:

  • Multi-agency advisories warn of BRICKSTORM, a sophisticated Golang backdoor attributed to PRC state-sponsored actors (UNC5221/Warp Panda), targeting VMware vSphere and Windows for long-term persistence and credential extraction.
  • Revelations about Intellexa's Predator spyware detail remote access to customer systems, the "Aladdin" malicious mobile ad vector, and multiple Android/iOS zero-days enabling one-click infections.
  • Anthropic's SCONE-bench highlights AI agents' increasing proficiency in exploiting smart contract vulnerabilities, making profitable autonomous exploitation technically feasible.
  • Discover new zero-click agentic browser attacks capable of deleting entire Google Drives via LLM-powered assistants, alongside "HashJack" manipulating AI browsers with hidden prompts.
  • The FBI warns of evolving virtual kidnapping scams, now using AI-altered social media photos for fake proof-of-life.

‚ö†Ô∏è Critical Vulnerabilities Under Active Exploitation:

  • React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182): A critical insecure deserialisation flaw in React Server Components 'Flight' protocol, actively exploited by China-linked actors (Earth Lamia, Jackpot Panda) for unauthenticated RCE, causing a widespread Cloudflare outage.
  • A command injection vulnerability in Array AG Series VPN devices (ArrayOS AG 9.4.5.8 and earlier) is being actively exploited to plant PHP webshells and create rogue users. A fix is available in ArrayOS 9.4.5.9.

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, December 5, 2025
item.description:
üö® stdout Daily Brief: Your essential update on the past 24 hours in cyber security. We're dissecting active threats, emerging techniques, and critical vulnerabilities impacting organisations worldwide.

üí• Active Attacks & Breaches: Marquis Software Solutions suffered a ransomware attack, compromising 400,000 customers across 74 US banks, likely exploiting a SonicWall flaw. Cloudflare fended off a record 29.7 Tbps UDP DDoS from the AISURU botnet. Yearn Finance's yETH pool was exploited for $9 million due to a protocol flaw. The Shai-Hulud 2.0 supply chain attack exposed 400,000 secrets across npm and GitHub. Insider threats remain a concern, with arrests for data breaches at a government contractor and an Australian man sentenced for "Evil Twin" Wi-Fi attacks. Plus, COLDRIVER's spear-phishing campaigns are targeting non-profits with Proton Mail lures and adversary-in-the-middle pages.

üî¨ New Threats & Techniques: Discover the latest in cyber tradecraft. The Chinese-speaking GoldFactory group is deploying Android malware droppers via modified banking apps in Southeast Asia. New variants of BPFDoor and Symbiote Linux malware are exploiting extended Berkeley Packet Filters for stealth, incorporating IPv6 and dynamic port hopping. We're also seeing TangleCrypt, a new Windows malware packer used in Qilin ransomware attacks, leveraging BYOVD for EDR evasion. A fake "prettier-vscode-plus" extension in the VS Code Marketplace delivered the Anivia loader and OctoRAT. Concerningly, Anthropic's Claude Skills have been weaponised to execute MedusaLocker ransomware, exploiting persistent permissions. Chinese hackers are also using Brickstorm malware on VMware vSphere to create hidden rogue VMs and steal snapshots.

‚ö†Ô∏è Critical Vulnerabilities: Stay ahead of the exploit curve. Attackers are actively exploiting CVE-2025‚Äì8489, a critical privilege escalation flaw in King Addons for Elementor (WordPress). A maximum-severity RCE vulnerability (CVSS 10.0) has been disclosed in React Server Components and frameworks (CVE-2025-55182/CVE-2025-66478), with exploitation considered imminent ‚Äì patches are available and crucial. Microsoft also quietly patched CVE-2025-9491, a critical Windows shortcut (.lnk) file bug exploited since 2017 by state-sponsored groups.

üåê Threat Landscape & Strategic Shifts: A new report highlights AI-powered attacks, large-scale JavaScript injection, and surging Magecart as key threats reshaping web security. Russia has blocked FaceTime and Snapchat, citing security concerns, while Let's Encrypt plans to reduce SSL/TLS certificate validity to 45 days by 2028 for improved internet security. International agencies, including Australia, have released joint guidelines for securely integrating AI into Operational Technology environments. NATO also conducted its largest-ever Cyber Coalition exercise, focusing on defending critical infrastructure against complex hybrid threats.

item.title: Daily News Update: Wednesday, December 3, 2025
item.description:
Dive into the latest cyber security developments! üá¶üá∫ This stdout episode unpacks critical incidents, including the University of Pennsylvania's data breach, linked to Clop ransomware's exploitation of CVE-2025-61882 in Oracle E-Business Suite. We also cover the FTC's action against Illuminate Education for a 2021 breach exposing 10 million student records, and the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea Council confirming a data exfiltration event from shared IT systems. Plus, a significant Microsoft Defender XDR portal outage disrupted threat hunting for over 10 hours.

Explore emerging threats: üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The Glassworm malware campaign resurfaces, targeting VS Code extension marketplaces with invisible Unicode and Rust-based implants to steal GitHub, npm, and crypto wallet data. Iran-linked MuddyWater deploys the new MuddyViper backdoor via spearphishing critical infrastructure, disguised as a classic Snake game. North Korea's Famous Chollima (Lazarus) is luring engineers into a fake IT worker scheme using AI and deepfakes to bypass KYC. We also detail the Shai-Hulud 2.0 NPM malware attack, compromising over 800 packages and exposing 400,000 raw secrets across GitHub repositories.

Stay ahead of vulnerabilities: üö® Google's December Android security update patches 107 flaws, including two actively exploited zero-days (CVE-2025-48633 & CVE-2025-48572) affecting the Android framework. In the wider threat landscape, Europol's Operation Olympia successfully shut down Cryptomixer, a crypto laundering platform that processed over ‚Ç¨1.3 billion. We also examine new U.S. legislation proposing sanctions for 'critical cyber threat actors' and India's controversial mandate for the unremovable 'Sanchar Saathi' app on all new smartphones, raising privacy concerns. Finally, insights from the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee hearing on the Salt Typhoon operation highlight debates on regulatory oversight versus voluntary information sharing.

item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, December 2, 2025
item.description:
Stay ahead with stdout! üá¶üá∫ This episode dives into the last 24 hours of cyber developments, featuring a massive data breach impacting 33.7 million Coupang customers and a critical supply chain attack on the SmartTube Android TV app. We also cover the French Football Federation's member data compromise.

We track active threats, including the Lazarus Group's alleged $30 million crypto heist from Upbit and the arrest of individuals exploiting 120,000 IP cameras. Plus, an Australian man faces jail time for Wi-Fi Pineapple attacks, and authorities dismantle the ‚Ç¨1.3 billion Cryptomixer service. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

New threat research reveals the Tomiris actor's use of Telegram/Discord for C2, and the seven-year "ShadyPanda" operation infecting 4.3 million Chrome/Edge users with malicious browser extensions. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è We also expose 17,000 live secrets found in public GitLab repositories.

In regulatory news, Switzerland advises against hyperscale clouds for sensitive data, Singapore issues directives to Google/Apple on fake government messages, and Russia imposes 'restrictive measures' on WhatsApp. ‚öñÔ∏è The FTC also settles with Illuminate Education over a 2021 student data breach, highlighting poor security practices and delayed notifications.

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, December 1, 2025
item.description:
üö® Active Exploitation Alert! CISA has added CVE-2021-26829 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalogue. This critical cross-site scripting flaw in OpenPLC ScadaBR is being actively exploited by the pro-Russian hacktivist group TwoNet. Learn how they gained initial access via default credentials, established persistence, and defaced HMI login pages in industrial control systems. We also detail TwoNet's evolving tactics, from DDoS to targeting industrial systems and offering ransomware-as-a-service. üõ†Ô∏è

üåç Plus, a deep dive into a long-running exploit operation uncovered by VulnCheck. Discover the Google Cloud-hosted Out-of-Band Application Security Testing (OAST) endpoint driving over 1,400 exploit attempts across 200+ CVEs, primarily targeting Brazil. We reveal the custom Java class file, TouchFile.class, expanding on a public Fastjson RCE exploit (v1.2.47) to execute commands and make outbound HTTP requests. Stay informed on the latest threats and techniques impacting the cyber landscape. üõ°Ô∏è

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, November 30, 2025
item.description:
üö® On stdout today: We dissect the significant data breach impacting Japanese beer giant Asahi Group Holdings. üç∫

Explore the fallout from the September ransomware attack, claimed by the Qilin group, which compromised personal data for up to 1.9 million individuals ‚Äì including customers, external contacts, and current/retired employees.

Key details include:

  • Exposed Data: Full names, genders, physical & email addresses, phone numbers. Dates of birth for employees.
  • No Payment Card Info: Asahi confirms payment card details were not compromised.
  • Ongoing Response: Two months post-incident, Asahi continues system restoration and implements enhanced cyber defence strategies, including redesigned communication routes and tightened network controls. üõ°Ô∏è

item.title: Daily News Update: Saturday, November 29, 2025
item.description:
üö® stdout Daily Briefing: Your essential update on the last 24 hours in cybersecurity. üö®

This episode unpacks major breaches including a $30M Solana heist from Upbit, a data compromise affecting 230,000+ Brsk customers, the French Football Federation's data leak, and Asahi's encounter with Qilin ransomware impacting 1.5 million. üìâ

We dive deep into new threats: the Shai-Hulud 2.0 npm worm that exfiltrated credentials from 25,000+ developers via CI/CD misconfiguration, and a critical Microsoft Teams guest access blind spot bypassing MDO365 protections. Plus, discover 17,000+ exposed live secrets across GitLab Cloud repos, including GCP and OpenAI keys. üîë

Also on the agenda: California's new universal opt-out law for data sharing, GrapheneOS's departure from OVHcloud over French privacy concerns, the UK's Budget forecast leak via a guessable URL, and an Australian man sentenced for operating "evil twin" Wi-Fi networks to steal credentials. üá¶üá∫

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, November 28, 2025
item.description:
üö® Breaches & Active Campaigns: This episode of stdout dives into the latest cyber incidents, including the permanent shutdown of Crisis24's OnSolve CodeRED following an INC ransomware attack and PII leak. We unpack Asahi's Qilin ransomware fallout impacting nearly two million individuals, and the ShinyHunters breach affecting Gainsight's Salesforce-connected apps. Plus, an OpenAI API data breach via smishing, the FCC's alarm over US radio equipment hijacking, and the Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' new campaign targeting Zendesk users with typosquatting and weaponised helpdesk tickets.

üõ†Ô∏è New Threats & Techniques: Get across the emerging tactics from threat actors. We analyse the ShadowV2 botnet, a Mirai variant exploiting 8 known vulnerabilities in IoT devices, and ESET's detailed report on QuietEnvelope, a sophisticated, state-sponsored toolset targeting OpenFind MailGates with stealthy backdoors. Discover how Russia-aligned Water Gamayun APT is exploiting MSC EvilTwin (CVE-2025-26633) for code injection, and the expansion of Bloody Wolf APT's NetSupport RAT attacks incorporating geofencing. We also cover the novel EtherHiding technique using blockchain smart contracts to deliver infostealers, and why Tycoon 2FA (Storm-1747) is now the most prolific Phishing-as-a-Service platform, leveraging real-time Adversary-in-the-Middle tactics.

üîç Vulnerabilities & Landscape Insights: We examine an unpatched flaw in the Retell AI API enabling large-scale social engineering, and Kaspersky's report on a significant surge in phishing attacks, with nearly half targeting online shoppers. Hear Australia's Director-General of Security warn of Chinese state-backed hackers probing critical infrastructure, and a deep dive into the dark web job market's mirroring of real-world economies, with high demand for reverse engineers and penetration testers.

üõ°Ô∏è Security Posture & Regulatory Updates: Stay informed on key defensive and policy shifts. Singapore mandates new anti-spoofing protections for Apple and Google by December 2025, and Microsoft announces plans to block unauthorised script injection attacks in Entra ID authentication from October 2026. Plus, updates on Microsoft Defender for Office 365's new capability to automatically remove malicious calendar entries.

item.title: Daily News Update: Thursday, November 27, 2025
item.description:
üö® Active Cyber Events & Breaches: This episode unpacks a flurry of recent attacks, including the INC Ransomware group's strike on Crisis24's OnSolve CodeRED, disrupting emergency alerts and exposing sensitive PII like clear-text passwords. We also cover a suspected ransomware incident affecting shared IT services for London councils, Comcast's $1.5M FCC fine following a vendor breach impacting 274,000 customers, and Dartmouth College's data theft linked to a Russian campaign targeting Oracle E-Business Suite. Plus, Gainsight's breach potentially compromised over 200 Salesforce instances, and a malicious Chrome extension, "Crypto Copilot," was found siphoning Solana funds with hidden fees.

üõ†Ô∏è New Threat Research & Techniques: Dive into the latest tradecraft with Akira ransomware affiliates exploiting compromised SonicWall SSL VPNs of acquired companies for rapid lateral movement. We explore the rise of "AI-for-evil" Large Language Models like WormGPT 4, lowering the barrier for generating ransomware scripts and spear phishing emails. Discover how the Russia-aligned RomCom actor is using SocGholish fake updates to deliver Mythic Agent malware, and the Shai-Hulud v2 supply chain attack's expansion to the Maven ecosystem, compromising over 830 packages by stealing API keys and GitHub tokens. üö® stdout Daily Briefing: Your essential dive into the last 24 hours of cyber security. We're tracking critical active events, novel attack techniques, and newly exploited vulnerabilities.

F5 confirms a nation-state breach by China-nexus group UNC5221, stealing BIG-IP source code and maintaining 12 months of access. New Threat Research & Techniques: North Korean actors UNC5342 are using EtherHiding to conceal JADESNOW and InvisibleFerret malware within Binance Smart Chain smart contracts, distributed via job scams. A new GNU/Linux rootkit, LinkPro, was found in an AWS compromise, leveraging eBPF for stealth. Android devices face Pixnapping (CVE-2025-48561), a side-channel attack to steal 2FA codes and Google Maps timelines. We also cover SEO poisoning leading to fake Ivanti Pulse Secure VPN sites, Qilin ransomware's ties to bulletproof hosting, widespread Microsoft-branded phishing, and multi-country smishing campaigns targeting taxpayers and drivers. macOS users are targeted by social engineering via fake Homebrew/TradingView sites deploying stealer malware, alongside phishing impersonating 1Password and LastPass breach notifications. Plus, a deep dive into SocGholish (FakeUpdates) and a coordinated campaign of 131 WhatsApp Web automation tool clones for large-scale spamming.

Exploited Vulnerabilities: CISA has added five critical flaws to its KEV Catalogue, confirming active exploitation. This includes CVE-2025-33073, a Windows SMB privilege escalation allowing SYSTEM privileges, and CVE-2025-61884, a server-side request forgery in Oracle E-Business Suite. Also, authentication bypasses in Kentico Xperience CMS (CVE-2025-2746, CVE-2025-2747) and an Apple JavaScriptCore RCE (CVE-2022-48503). Urgent patching is advised for nearly 76,000 publicly exposed WatchGuard Firebox appliances vulnerable to CVE-2025-9242, a critical 9.3 CVSS remote code execution flaw exploitable without authentication. üí° CTEM Insights: An overview of Continuous Threat Exposure Management, emphasising prioritisation based on business impact and validation through breach and attack simulation.

We also discuss in-the-wild exploitation of a **Pandoc SSRF (CVE-2025-51591)** targeting AWS IMDS, new **Supermicro BMC firmware vulnerabilities** allowing persistent control, and an unpatched **OnePlus OxygenOS flaw (CVE-2025-10184)** exposing SMS data. üí•

Finally, we examine the broader impact of cyberattacks, including the **Jaguar Land Rover production halt** and the catastrophic collapse of KNP Logistics Group due to an Akira ransomware attack exploiting a single weak password. item.title: Daily News Update: Tuesday, September 23, 2025
item.description:
Daily stdout: Cyber Events, Exploits & Techniques

Your daily deep dive into the latest in cybersecurity! üöÄ Today, we're unpacking significant disruptions, from European aviation chaos caused by a Collins Aerospace ransomware attack to Dallas Fort Worth International Airport's fibre optic woes. Catch up on the latest arrests linked to the 2023 Scattered Spider attacks on MGM and Caesars, costing over $100 million. üí∏ Plus, Stellantis confirms a data leak via a compromised Salesforce provider, with ShinyHunters claiming 18 million records. Even France's Natural History Museum wasn't safe, losing gold nuggets after a ransomware attack disabled security. üèõÔ∏è And a verified Steam game, 'BlockBlasters,' turned malicious, siphoning $150,000 from 261 accounts with a cryptodrainer.

Dive into cutting-edge threat research, including 'EDR-Freeze,' a novel user-mode technique that can indefinitely suspend EDR and antivirus processes without a kernel driver. ü•∂ We also analyse new campaigns: ComicForm targeting Eurasian sectors with Formbook, and the pro-Russian SectorJ149 (UAC-0050) deploying Lumma Stealer, Formbook, and Remcos RAT against South Korean industries. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è LastPass warns macOS users about fake software impersonating password managers, delivering the Atomic (AMOS) info-stealer, now with a backdoor component.

On the vulnerability front, Microsoft patched a critical CVE-2025-55241 in Entra ID (CVSS 10.0), allowing global administrator impersonation. üö® The American Archive of Public Broadcasting also fixed an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) flaw that exposed private media for years. In the broader threat landscape, AT&T highlights Chinese Salt Typhoon's influence on 'living off the land' techniques, while the FBI warns of spoofed IC3 websites. üåê Lloyds Banking Group's AI implementation shows the tightrope walk between innovation and security, blocking platforms like Hugging Face.

Data privacy takes centre stage with patients advocating for stronger neural data rights as scientists decode inner speech from Brain Computer Interface (BCI) implants. üß† Regulatory hurdles loom as CISA 2015 faces expiration, potentially increasing cyber risk, and Senator Tom Cotton proposes an 18-month 'clean' reauthorization of FISA Section 702 amidst privacy concerns.

Finally, the US government mandates a transition to NIST's new post-quantum cryptography standards by 2030/2035 to counter 'harvest now, decrypt later' threats. üîí ICE HSI has acquired Magnet Forensics' Graykey software for device unlocking. Plus, Mozilla introduces a new Firefox feature allowing add-on developers to roll back to previous approved versions for quicker bug fixes. ü¶ä

item.title: Daily News Update: Monday, September 22, 2025
item.description:
üö® On this episode of stdout, we're diving deep into two critical cybersecurity developments:

  • Microsoft Entra ID Vulnerability (CVE-2025-55241): Discover how a critical flaw, leveraging undocumented "actor tokens" and a deprecated API, could have granted Global Administrator privileges across any Entra ID tenant globally. Learn about the stealthy exploitation potential and Microsoft's swift patch.

üá∞üáµ We then pivot to the evolving tactics of North Korean state-sponsored hacking groups, including Lazarus, ScarCruft (APT37), and Kimsuky (APT43). Expect insights into:

  • Sophisticated Social Engineering: How "ClickFix" lures in fake cryptocurrency job scams deliver malware like BeaverTail and InvisibleFerret, with expanded targeting beyond software developers.
  • ScarCruft's Shift: A notable move from pure espionage to financially motivated and potentially destructive operations, deploying VCD ransomware for the first time, alongside new tools like the Rust-based CHILLYCHINO and FadeStealer. üí∏
  • Kimsuky's Innovation: Abuse of GitHub repositories for malware delivery and data exfiltration, plus their alarming use of OpenAI's ChatGPT to forge deepfake military ID cards in spear-phishing campaigns targeting South Korean defence entities. ü§ñ

item.title: Daily News Update: Sunday, September 21, 2025
item.description:
üö® stdout uncovers a critical zero-click vulnerability, codenamed ShadowLeak, in OpenAI ChatGPT's Deep Research agent. Crafted emails leveraging indirect prompt injection could exfiltrate sensitive Gmail inbox data directly from OpenAI's cloud infrastructure, bypassing traditional client-side defences. This flaw, now patched, highlights risks with enabled third-party integrations. üìß

Next, we expose a widespread campaign targeting macOS users with the potent Atomic Stealer malware. Threat actors are deploying fake GitHub repositories impersonating legitimate tools like LastPass and 1Password, using SEO poisoning to push malicious downloads. This campaign underscores persistent social engineering and supply chain compromise tactics. üíª

Finally, a significant regulatory crackdown: the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has shut down the TradeOgre cryptocurrency exchange, seizing over $40 million. This marks Canada's first crypto exchange shutdown, driven by failures in FINTRAC registration and Know Your Customer (KYC) policies, making it a conduit for cybercrime money laundering. üí∞

item.title: Daily News Update: Friday, September 19, 2025
item.description:
Dive into the latest cyber threats and vulnerabilities impacting the digital landscape. Critical vulnerabilities and essential patches: Google has issued an urgent update for a **sixth Chrome zero-day (CVE-2025-10585)** actively exploited in the wild.
